When young, my husband and I were 'ordered' by an older brother to take his cat, a beautiful elusive Persian who had a preference for my spouse, while I fed both of them with care.

When separated, he was left to feed the cat, and feeling that she was neglected, she went to a married couple who loved and toured the world with her for the next 19 years, until she slept away one night in Ethiopia, and international tears of purrs were shed.

In my mid-30s, the true love of my life was a little Burmese and when she died, the pain of it all was so great that I was told that I should never have a cat again.

Today I look like the typical elderly lady with the 'invisible' cat. People believe that I have a set of whiskers called 'Spike', and letters about theirs, gifts, books, photos, anecdotes are shared between many of us all. The truth of the kibble is that I have a preference for dogs. Why share this chewy toy bone with them late at this stage, and let the cat out of the bag?

Today, it is a childhood friend alone far away that I am thinking of. Living for the Love of her cat, they are both on the phone when I call. A happy couple, it makes me worry about what is going to happen if she is left a widow. Since curiosity killed the cat, as the saying goes, I am not going to venture further, except to add that another friend just wrote earlier 'One can never be lonely with a pet'.

To Charlie who just lost his budgerigar, Elbert, to Tim Krieder's cat, this one is for you.

Then the seizures started. It took nearly two years to get them under control, and she has regressed so much that we don't even allow ourselves that fantasy anymore. It's as if her brain rebooted, but it didn't quite work. Is it the seizures? Is it meds? Does it matter which?

It is standard medical procedure that if a patient is depressed and having suicidal thoughts (or homicidal thoughts) to inquired if they have a weapon. Doctors have to evaluate the threat level of a person in harming themselves of others.

It is not a routine question, nor asked of many patents, but if harm is an issue, it is asked. It is not a political agenda at all, but an actively suicidal (homicidal) patient may require hospitalization.

Sea Turtles? Maybe they are still on their plodding way to court. We humans argue over money because, like the sea turtles, we need to eat, feed our children and house ourselves. Call that arrogant, but if that is so, then those pesky sea turtles are the most arrogant of creatures.
For a lot of people this argument is irrelevant, since all of us have been around for 6000 years.

Claims that actually weren't affected by the oil spill should be tossed. But there are claims that haven't been made because the aggrieved can't sue. How many sea turtles died, birds, etc. There is no question that BP should pay but the money should go to restoration rather than scammers.

Before mankind sea turtles could lay tens of thousands of eggs and not worry that only 5% made it to the ocean, the overwhelming number of hatchings meant that predators couldn't affect the population. Then man began harvesting the nests and it began a downward spiral.

The oil spill could be the death throe for sea turtles as they probably don't warrant "lawyers" like humans. Turtles first surfaced on earth 32 million years before the dinosaurs. I find it very arrogant that we humans argue over money and don't care about creatures that existed long before we did.

The GOP wants to cut Social Security and the Democrats are trying to strengthen it. Have you noticed?

That means not part-time and low-paying jobs (the June report was just awful although good on the surface.)

@mford

You are missing the point I made. The point is that even the most dovish, liberal, accommodating Israelis are now talking like the hawks. They have reached the breaking point. They left Gaza and their security situation deteriorated. They saw the Gaza population choose a terrorist organization to represent them, and saw them invest enormous energy and resources in acquiring weapons to unleash on Israeli civilians.

Your false equivalency rhetoric is disingenuous. For one, Gaza has a full border with Egypt to trade freely. For another, Israel is totally committed to leave Gaza alone, so long as no fighters or rockets cross into Israel (or the preparations and smuggling for such).

So your false equivalency example should be....

"What if one of your neighbors prevents you from crossing into his yard, and reserves the right to make sure you are not digging a tunnel under his house to attack him, and not stockpiling weapons to launch into him, which after all you announced to the world that you are fully committed to the total destruction of your neighbor".

To which I'd answer. "I'd acknowledge my neighbors right to exist, I'd renounce any weapons or tunnels against him. And I'd go on with my life trading with the other neighbor, until such time as the blockading neighbors felt comfortable trading with me again".
